comments.body:
This is all great.

I think we should make a slight change to the framing in the documentation for nonconst. Rather than saying it's to avoid lints, I think we should say it's to convert a const literal into a non-const value, so that it can be used to call a const constructor in such a way as to create a new instance rather than creating the common const instance.

Also, we shouldn't use "we" or "you" in the docs; our style is to use the passive voice.
